title: Melania Trump wows in stunning Inaugural Ball dress she helped design - in second echo of Jackie Kennedy
text:

It looks like Melania Trump is turning out to be quite good at this fashion thing. 
First things first, she didn’t wear a dress by a fledgling American designer. But then we always predicted that would far to subtle a message for an administration that was all about glitz and glamour . And we were right. Infact, Melania didn’t even wear a dress by an American designer AT ALL. 
But that’s not to say some serious thought hadn’t gone into her gown choice. With strong echoes of Jackie O, whose style she had channelled earlier in the day , Melania opted to design her gown, in collaboration with Herve Pierre, the former creative director of Carolina Herrera. Clever girl. Donald and Melania arriving at his "Liberty" Inaugural Ball in Washington DC last night (Photo: REUTERS) 
We all know that a fashion conscious Jacqueline Kennedy endeared herself to the American public with her canny use of style. As First Lady she took the importance of image to a whole new level . 
One example of this was designing her own inauguration gown with the help of Bergdorf’s Ethan Frankou, demonstrating her fashion prowess, and also the extent of her control over her public image. Read More 
The off white, sleeveless, silk chiffon gown was embroidered with silver thread, and had an accompanying cape - and the American public loved it. Jackie Kennedy captured the imagination of the American public (Photo: Getty) 
So Melania has cleverly revisited Jackie O’s story once again. Interestingly, red carpet designer Carolina Herrera was one of our predictions to design Melania’s gown, but this makes for a much better story. 
The ivory off the shoulder column dress featured a swooping arc across the torso and a crimson waist ribbon. Simple and elegant with a subtle leg baring slit Melania looked undeniably stunning. Melania designed her gown in collaboration with Herve Pierre (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
Designer Herve Pierre told Women’s Wear Daily, "She knows what she likes. Our conversations were, and are, very easy. She knows about fashion, as a former model. She is aware about constructions, so we have already the same vocabulary when it comes to designing a dress." 
Interestingly Pierre, an accomplished designer in his own right, has previously hold positions at Oscar de la Renta and Vera Wang. 
In the past this means he's worked with Hillary Clinton , when he designed for Oscar de la Renta, and also Laura Bush and Michelle Obama during his time at Carolina Herrera. The Bardot style topline is very on trend (Photo: REUTERS) Melania let her hair down (Photo: AFP)
